38866970.review: A really great little horror experience, tha strikes an interesting balance between gruesome and comedic deaths, and a harrowing plotline that covers very dark topics with intelligence and simplicity. Absolutely worth the price, even though the game is extremely short.

38807081.review: Great story, would recommend. Replay value is low after the second run, but given the price, one shouldn't expect otherwise. One thing I prefer about "Mad Father" over this is: MF has another side of the story hidden beneth the plot; this one is stright-forward.

38805653.review:
FIRST OFF, definitely need to play the non-steam version. Regardless whether you play this before or after, just play them both.
I love this game. Its relatively short, if you know what you're doing at least. It's rich with story and even though its slightly cliche it doesn't feel like it is at all. Its not like absolutely full of jumpscares, but there definitely are quite a few. It's also filled with a bunch of different ways to die, and really cool themes. 
The female protagonist is definitely the best in my opinion. She's the original and the boy is a pansy. 
There's tons of mad father references in this game too. :)
I really liked playing this and now I wanna go replay the old version.

38659492.review:
Mad Father ın yapımcısından Yenilenmiş haliyle Misao! steame gelmesine ilk ben bayram ettim direk bastım parayı 

Misao RPGmaker programı ile yapılmış puzzle tarzı bir korku oyunu Konusu kısaca Misao adındaki bir kızın ortadan kaybolmasının üzerine öldüğüne ilişkin söylentilerin çıkmasıyla başlıyor. Aki isimli arkadaşı sürekli onun Bul beni, Yardım et bana seslerini duyuyor ve sonrasında da ilginç olaylar baş gösteriyor gerisi spoiler olmadan susayım :

Oyunun artıları:

+ Sesler
+ Karakter çizimleri
+ Ortam, Çevre sizi rpg maker bile olsa korkuyu ve gizemi hissettiren oyunlardan
+ Yenilenmiş hali bir çok değişik ve güzel şeyler var hepside on numara olmuş ben çok eski sürümü denemiştim 1-2 önce 
+ Karakterlerin tepkileri eski oyuna göre hareketleri vs çok değişmiş gerçeğe daha yakın bir hale gelmiş 
+ Sürükleyici gizem dolu hikaye 
+ Ah güzel Misaom öyle masum tatlısın ki 

Oyunun eksileri:

-Rpgmaker oyunlarının genelinde bu durum var çözünürlük desteklemediğinden oyunu ortada sağı solu siyah ekranda oynuyoruz umarım güncelleme ile 1920x1080 oynayabiliriz


Oyunun başka bir eksisi yok Eski sürümlerde farklı sonlar vardı definitive editionda aynısı varmı bilemem ama sanırım var çünkü ben bitirmeden acele edip inceleme yazdım

Dipnot : Rpgmaker ile yapılmış oyunların çoğu insan grafiğini sevmez vs vs yada bune der kapatır ama bu oyunlar cidden kendini oynattırıyor asla pişman olmazsınız kesinlikle öneriyorum

Another great pixel horror that plays off of Mad Father well, containing interesting consequences of your decisions in the previous game, continuing to build the universe of the games and the rules within them whilst still succeeding at being its own isolated story.

Misao è stato uno dei miei primi RPG horror maker games anni fa e ho giocato ad entrambe le versioni precedenti free.

Mi piace l'evoluzione che ha avuto, tra sprite dei personaggi e tilesets, e tutte le aggiunte inserite (tra cui certi segreti e reference dei quali ora si capisce di più il tutto). Lo consiglio sia a chi non lo ha mai giocato e a chi invece è un veterano/conoscente di RPG. Misao è un must, per la storia e gameplay!

37756767.review:
I loved everything about this game. It only took about two hours to complete, the puzzles weren't too difficult, and the story was completely enthralling. I was entirely pulled into Misao's story and the mystery of her death. 

TRIGGER WARNING:
There are some very very dark themes to this game. If you have experienced severe bullying, sexual assault trauma, or severe depression/suicidal thoughts...this might not be a good game for you to play. I experienced all of the above and was able to handle it (but I've had years and years of therapy) so please be cautious for your health! 

Overall, I really enjoyed the game! The best part is the replay-ability since the storyline is slightly different with the male and female protagonists and there are two different endings.

37709100.review: Solid horror RPG with well-designed artwork and puzzles. The non-linear approach to your objectives made this a lot more fun than similar games that I've played. I enjoyed discovering all the various things that will kill you and thankfully the game made this painless since you can save frequently. The story was very basic/cliche but well executed so I didn't mind.

37644654.review:
Misao: Definitive Edition is a great remake of a classic rpg maker horror game, with so much new stuff but let’s talk about story first.

You can play as a boy or girl version of the main Character. But this will have a major impact on the story itself, but some of the dialogue and scenes differ slightly for the different genders and personalities. 

But anyway you play as Aki a young high school student. Aki goes to school after having a dream about Misao a young girl who went missing three months ago. 

At school some of the kids are taking about her only for an earthquake to happen, after being knocked out Aki wakes only to see something is not right with the school.

Now this game was made by the people who made mad father but unlike mad father watch was remastered. Misao: Definitive Edition is all most a complete remake, New Pixel Graphics, New ways to die, and some new cutscenes.

Now what I liked, well as someone who has played the original, I loved all the new things. The New Pixel Graphics, the new ways to die, and the new cutscenes. 

All so liked how they got rid of some of the silly stuff in it. Like Kudoh’s death. Liked the Improved puzzles. Music was good.

Now for the bad, only thing the game needed was a little map of the school. But that’s about.

So in conclusion Misao: Definitive Edition is a solid remake of a classic rpg maker horror game and I recommend it wholeheartedly, old fans well like the updates, and new fans get to play a great classic rpg maker horror game.

37432961.review:
If you like trial and error games, you'll like this.  If you want to know where Mad Father went next, you'll like this.  If you want to speculate about the universe, you'll like this.

As a person who grew up this game, it's great, but the changed layout startled me a bit.  It also left me in the dark where the most logical places I needed to go were (as the vending machine used to be in the 1F Hall, but now it's in the Cafeteria).  Stuff like that.  But a person who doesn't know about this game and wants to play it, it can be sort of refreshing!

37426285.review: Misao: Definitive Edition è un gioco coinvolgente e spaventoso. Creato precedentemente come un gioco freeware reperibile da internet, è stato modificato in modo che contienga molti elementi e meccaniche nuove, per non parlare delle mappe, puzzles e sprites totalmente cambiati e migliorati. La storia ruota attorno alla scomparsa di una compagna di scuola, Misao, la quale lancia una maledizione alla scuola trasportandola in un'altra dimensione piena di spiriti vendicativi. Il nostro compito è di spezzare la maledizione, ma anche aiutare Misao che chiede di essere trovata. Il personaggio può essere scelto dal giocatore: può essere maschile o femminile e anche il nome può essere scelto (anche se canonicamente i nomi sono Akito e Aki). E' consigliabile giocare il gioco con entrambi i personaggi, poichè alcune situazioni cambieranno. E' un gioco consigliatissimo, che non potete non avere nella libreria. E se avete giocato alle versioni precedenti, a poco prezzo potrete reperire la versione definitiva (ora che ci sono pure i saldi autunnali!)

36610116.review:
I'm very much into pixel horror RPGs, and I've seen people play the original version of Misao.  This 'Definitive Edition' is an updated version that has revamped certain things and changed certain elements of the game in ways that I believe improve the game in some ways and maybe serve a little to its detriment in others.

The old trope of 'dead student sets curse on high school' is pretty well explored across games and anime, and Misao does fall into that cliche category, but at the same time, it has its charms.  It almost makes a joke out of how easy it is to unexpectedly meet your doom in this game - there are over 40 ways to die in Misao, most of them insta-death moments a result of either accidentally or purposely interacting with a trap, and some of them are completely ridiculous!  The death sound followed by the game over screen almost becomes a meme by the end of it...  it becomes a competition, like the Pokemon of deaths...  gotta find em all!  I won't lie though, it becomes infuriating if you're not familiar with all of the traps or you just forget, and then you make some good headway with the plot but then fall victim to a stupid trap and then have to reload way further back...  my advice is to QUICKSAVE ALL THE TIME.  Literally after you do every little thing.  There are so many opportunities to die that it seems almost unavoidable sometimes.  Save like a maniac and watch where you're going, what's around you and what you're touching.  Otherwise you'll be in for a world of hell.

For those that have played the original, there are a few changes that are a bit jarring or confusing.  They changed pretty much the whole layout of the school, so things weren't where I thought they were and I kept getting confused.  If you've never played the original though, you obviously won't have this issue.  Another big change was that in this Definitive Edition, you collect objects that are associated with Misao, whereas the original had you collecting her physical body parts.  I think the change took a little of the horror aspect out of the game, since you're picking up hair ties and jackets, which is a lot less disturbing than finding yourself holding your dead friend's rotting brain in your hands.  It kinda softens the creep factor a bit.  However, another change is the addition of choosing whether the protagonist is male or female, which actually has an effect on the events of the game and grants an additional two endings.  I do like that expansion.

I have one last criticism for Misao, and I feel bad for it, but while games are meant to be challenging, I actually got stuck and had to look up what I was meant to do next because there were so many things to interact with in the game, I couldn't be sure what I was meant to do in what order, and this is coming from someone who already knows the general outline of the game.  Perhaps I was just being stupid and you guys might find it no problem, but I play these kinds of games a lot so I'm usually used to their puzzles, but Misao had me a bit lost at times.  I do have to mention the fact that I believe Misao was the first game ever created by its developer as a test to see what they could make, so with that being said, we can give Misao the benefit of the doubt in that it was not intended as an incredible, polished and perfectly thought out game.  Everyone starts somewhere.

Despite these little drawbacks, what does redeem Misao is the way its plot comes to its end.  There are several endings you can reach, each one exploring one horrible conclusion after another.  If you achieve the 'true' end, you'll then activate an extra option on the main menu which then extends the game by a whole extra scenario that really fills in a lot of lore and goes further into the plot which you thought was over.  It's eye-opening stuff that makes you think, and does give you a satisfied feeling that going through the myriad insta-deaths and confusing puzzles was worth it.  The enjoyment of how the story ends definitely outweighs any of the aforementioned elements you may find annoying.  There are better games in this genre, but I'd still recommend you give Misao a play.  It comes from the same developer that created Mad Father, which is a really good game, so I'd recommend you try both.  Speaking of Mad Father...

I said this in my Mad Father review, so I'll keep it short and spoiler free, but basically...  If you play Mad Father before Misao, you're going to be very surprised and intrigued at some of the things that appear in Misao.  I won't tell you details, but playing Misao will give you extra insights into some of the biggest mysteries that remain unsolved in Mad Father...  there's something strange going on, I tell you.  Play Misao second and you'll know what I mean.

36602332.review:
Played the original years ago along with Mad Father, Witch's House, Ib and others.
While some of the stuff were removed, i like this remake. This was created by the same developer than Mad Father, and they like the idea of connecting the both game stories together, so expect a few references if you played Mad Father first.

It's a japanese horror story game about a school girl who was bullied way too much while alive, and now she has become a vengeful spirit. Like my description for Mad Father, this may make it sound cheesy, but it's not.

I do not recommend this at all for any children or people who either have low resistance to jumpscares or have been through huge bullying problems anytime during their life. 

[b]But if you WERE THE BULLY[/b], then [b]PLEASE PLAY THIS GAME[/b].

You'll understand how far can small "fun" influence a person's life even years later.

Like Madfather, is a visual novel that plays like an exploration game with puzzles and hidden stuff. It's way more interesting than just texts and standing still portaits.

The game has a lot of death traps. No seriously there's even an in-game list on the main entrance of the school. Abuse the quicksave system because you're gonna need it. Don't forget to also regularly save from time to time.

You play as a Misao's colleague and your mission is to help put the girl's ghost to rest. and maybe save your other colleagues too. A bit cliché, but it works!

36494572.review:
Misao: Definitive Edition n'est pas qu'une simple refonte graphique du jeu; c'est un remake à part entière.

Mis a part le redesign graphique évident du jeu, on nous accueille avec quelques nouvelles musiques, des death traps tout neufs ou retravaillés, et de nouvelles séquences altérant légèrement le déroulement du jeu sans pour autant en changer l'histoire, incluant nouveaux puzzles et cinématiques. L'inventaire du jeu original a été abandonné pour celui de Mad Father, et on a désormais la possibilité de courir.

Ayant joué aux versions 2 et 3 de l'original, je dois dire que ce Definitive Edition a su donner de la fraîcheur au jeu, permettant à ceux qui ont joué à l'original de garder un sentiment de nouvelle expérience. De plus, a titre personnel, j'ai appécié le fait que certains death traps ont été refaits sous la forme de jumpscares. C'est pour moi un petit plus qui est le bienvenu.

Cependant, il faut savoir que le jeu n'est qu'en anglais pour l'instant. Ayant un bon niveau d'anglais, ça ne me dérange pas, mais j'imagine que ça pourrait poser problème pour certains.

En tous les cas, je recommande! Que vous ayez joué au jeu original ou non, comptez au moins 3 heures de jeu pour le finir entièrement (moi, j'ai mis un peu moins de temps parce que j'ai déjà fait l'original). Et si Corpse Party vous parle, Misao est grosso-modo dans la même veine :)

36395748.review:
It's like 1000 Ways to Die high school edition. Be prepared to die from everything. (Quick-save often!)

The environment has a nice, classic feel. The soundtrack was well chosen.

Puzzles are tricky enough. There's a librarian (whom I named Gabriella) that can give you hints. (I refused to look up a walkthrough.) (Expect a little game logic.)

Story is feely enough. Dialogue is neat and the character art is well done. The female protagonist is a savage compared to the male, btw.

Overall, a good game.

36299225.review:
Misao é um jogo de terror 2d que conta a história de uma colegial chamada Misao, que desapareceu misteriosamente à 3 messes. No jogo jogamos com a Aki (Você pode mudar o nome dela) ou com sua versão masculina, Akito. A raiva de Misao para com seus colegas de classe fizeram com que a escola fosse amaldiçoada, somente Aki/Akito podem concertar isso.

 Joguei ambas as versões do jogo e posso arfirmar que essa é a melhor. A escola está totalmente diferente, quase irreconhecível, a arte e os puzzle do jogo mudaram bastante. A unica coisa que me deixou triste foi o fato da Sen ter mudado o uniforme dos estudantes (Eu gostava do anterior). Se você for jogar Misao eu recomendo que não tire o dedo do "C" Ou do "Shift" já que existe mais de 42 mortes no jogo. Cuidado a onde pisa e com quem fala.

36286989.review:
I'm very happy this game made it to Steam and grabbed it as soon as I saw it. As much as I liked the original version, I really enjoyed the overall improvement, such as character design, dialogue, and a bit more content. There are also a few things you can do that you couldn't do in the original game, which make certain parts slightly "easier."

The easter eggs thrown in were fun to stumble upon, as well. If you're a fan of the original game and "Mad Father," I recommend giving this a go.

36274247.review:
J'ai été surprise par l'annonce de ce remarke et bien impatiente d'y jouer à vrai dire. La nostalgie s'est ravivée en y rejouant avec le plaisir de retrouver le lycée de Misao dans une version encore plus spectaculaire et horrifique. Même un ancien joueur peut y trouver son bonheur en savourant d'autant plus cette expérience qu'il a connu, il y a quelques années. 
Le jeu propose le choix de deux protagonistes, et donc deux visions du jeu vraiment différentes puisque indépendemment de leur genre, les personnages ont chacun leur personnalité. 
Une petite perle qui vous emportera dans son monde.

It does change a few things like some dialogs as well as new graphics and  lots of different ways to die :P. The story remains pretty much the same as the original but less gruesome? Sort of. I liked that depending on the character that you decide to play with, you'll get different dialogs  and interactions with others well as changes in some of the events.

Overall the game is good, not as polished as MadFather but definetely it has been reworked and has a better pace than the free version. 

Sadly, very short. I completed both gameplays  and all achievements within 4 hours.

36250272.review:

New added elements, but I was disappointed about certain aspects being changed (i.e. key items being switched to mostly clothings and the change to Mr. Kurata's episode).

I was surprised that you could choose your protagonist instead of completing the female route first! I also recommend playing both sides because of dialogue and different mechanisms to complete a task.

36231104.review:
an RPG horror CLASSIC!!!! i've been playing misao since the first release and all the updates between then up to now. the sprites are updated and are beautiful. more ways to die which is always fun. i'm still trying to find all the ways to kill myself. 


i was a big fan of the 3.00 patch and this adds a lot more than that. in my opinion it's for sure worth the price.


hands down my favourite RPG horror game, along with mad father, IB and yume nikki. 


the map has changed a bit and the puzzles have changed a bit. it's fun for old players and new players. play this and support the creator.

36193508.review:
What it lacks in replayability, it makes up for with a solid tone and a fun experience. Misao: Definitive Edition does nothing to provoke the player with intricate gameplay tricks or groundbreaking premises; its true merit lies within the foundation of good ol' fashioned scares and gory goodness. To some, it's an immediate turn-off, as without any shred of creativity, the game could be just another title to those experienced with the horror genre. For what it's worth, outside the expectations of those who revel in its spooky genre, the game does offer eventful fun for those who aren't too careful about where they travel. Better yet, the game can be completed within an hour, so it'd be a nice atmospheric piece to play for Halloween!

+ A well-performing snack for horror fans
+ Solid atmosphere
+ Intriguing end-game content

- Little to no replayability
- Can be too vague with progression
- Sound effects are too cheesy

Read the full review at https://www.keengamer.com/article/17332_misao-definitive-edition-review

10/10

Worth the money because it gives depth and updated art to the original Misao everyone loves! <33333

36132375.review: Corto, divertido y con sus momentos de horror. Sin duda un juego muy recomendable, además lo puedes jugar con un nivel de inglés básico.

36130947.review:
Horror game from the same creators as Mad Father.  If you've played other RPGmaker horror games, you know what to expect.

This version of a somewhat classic horror game has a few updated visuals, a bit more backstory and changes in a few death scenes, to keep the content a bit more fresh for those who've played it in the past.

I think what really makes this game horrifying isn't really the scares, but more of the grounded aspects of the effects of heartbreak, bullying, and even at one point sexual harassment, and how each character deals with it. It's a ghost story that deals with the aftermath of actual repercussions each person brought upon themselves for their actions (or lack thereof).

Overall, a tragic, sad, and spooky story throughout. I think I found [spoiler]female Aki[/spoiler] as the scariest character of the game!

36114112.review: Much better than the original. Although they should rename this game as dumb ways to die. But still a fun game though.

36088954.review:
Misao's a short 'n sweet game about students getting supa spooked. Death is very much involved. The puzzles are pretty neat, and honestly, between me and you, most (if not all) of the deaths are actually... Pretty hecking funny to watch. The Quicksave feature is also pretty neato.
In the game, you can choose to play as a girl or a boy, both routes are essentially the same, albeit minor differences, I'd reccomend starting with the girl first, then play the game again as the boy.

If you played the freeware version way back in the day, this game might have some pleasant surprises for ya! 

Overall, a nice, good spooky experience that might make you jump in your seat at least once(?).

Short, tedious, and I loved how much was easy to die; a couple of them were totally unexpected and I was truly scared as hell (maybe because I was playing at night, in silence). There are one or two bugs but standing on his release (just a few days ago) could have been worse. Kek

36079859.review:
Geez, some good stuff is being released now. And it's improved.

10/10.
Glad I could be one of first players.

36079818.review:
There is a large lack of quality horror titles within the rpgmaker scene, this is one of the classics that I hadnt heard of until recently and its certainly gripping. 

Even with the very low fidelity of the engine this game still successfully manages to scare the crap of you and it isnt just jump scares actually i dont think ive encountered any jump scares, it all psychological scares and hard dog eat dog and us or them scenarios 

Admittedly its very abrupt in how it throw you into the mix, but for a short game it does have some deep fleshed out areas to consider and not all of it is out right told to you so you will have to connect the dots and understand where it was headed. The story is about a girl that has disappeared and how this evoked various demons to infect the campus of the school. 

To break it down to finish the game it takes around 2-4 hours depending on the difficulty you have in collecting the six artifacts. You can play as male or female and both do make a different to the story, there is then a true route for both the male and female protags which takes around 30minutes but that doesnt involve difficulty so it will not take that long. 

So in total you should get around 5-6hours of content, its not a lot but its certainly an enjoyable experience for what it is.  Also if you look around you will notice theres a good number of easter eggs

36077058.review:
Я ярый поклонник игр от sen. Поэтому, когда увидел новость о том, что Misao вышла в steam, то сразу купил.
Игра потрясная, просто шик. Та самая ситуация, когда хоррор игра  одновременно и пугает, и не забывает о сюжете( Собственно, другого от разработчицы игры я не ожидал. Как и в случае с Mad Father-ом тут присутсвует великолепный сюжет и скримеры, которые могут напугать до потери сознания( преувелично конечно же)) . 
[*]Насчёт скримеров. Они реально пугают, и некоторые настолько внезапно пытаются до меня добраться и убить, что я непроизвольно соскакиваю со стула. 
[*]Насчёт смертей. Их тут довольно много, и если сравнивать с Mad father, то Misao в этом плане явно лучше. Ведь они настолько непредсказуемы! Ты можешь просто идти, и вдруг, тебя убивает неведомая фигня и ты такой -"Holy shit! What the fuck is that!? 
В общем, эмоций куча. Но все они положительные.
Без предвзятости, с меня 10/10. [b]One of the best games for me.[/b]

36073442.review:

36072567.review: An improved version of the original freeware game plus an extra chapter exclusive to this release. If you're looking for a horror game or you like RPGMaker horror games in general, definitely pick this one up.

36060689.review: I still love this game so much! A quick, engaging play. One of my favorite RPG horror games. There's a lot of little things the game has reworked, including the Male Aki's route branching off, and I don't regret the purchase even for a minute.

36060373.review:
[b][u]IMPORTANT NOTICE:[/u][/b] A content warning to those who may have unpleasant mental scars in regards to harassment/bullying and sexual abuse and such events. I enjoy this game and its universe, but it does get exceedingly dark if you don't know what you're stepping into.

This game is in connection to [i]Mad Father[/i], released on Steam earlier and also a previously freeware game. If there is a question of to buy it or not for that, I would say to put your mind at ease. Both are worth buying as definite upgrades to the freeware version and, to get both games, you're paying around $10 to support the creator. I'd say it's fair.

Another rpgmaker horror classic. Good puzzles and plenty of scary concepts, brutal artwork, and a good long list of ways to die. Utilize your quicksave! In conjunction with [i]Mad Father[/i], I can not recommend [i]Misao[/i] enough, again, if you're a fan of rpgmaker horror as a genre or if you are interested in more story-driven games. 

Excellent timing in it being released so close to Halloween! Bonus scenes are available between the different gendered options, so more than one playthrough is advised.

36058188.review:
Misao was a very well received game back in the day, and while the slightly basic puzzles haven't aged as well as similar RPGmaker Horror games, like Ao Oni or IB, it's still more than worth the low price of this remake. The story is great, in many ways better than the one in the initial release. Characters have been fleshed out, the translation is better, overall more care has gone in to telling you an entertaining story, full of twists, all of which are brilliantly thought out and very entertaining. Some updated sprites, sounds and dialog changes help add a fresh coat of paint to this classic. Although there are a few strange graphical glitches and one or two spelling errors, I expect these are pretty easy to fix and judging by the active dev involvement in the community hub, I'm sure these kinks will be ironed out very quickly.

For such a low price, you can't really go wrong. I highly recommend you check this one out.

36053460.review:

が、CGやキャラグラフィックも新しくなっているので、ファンならぜひ。

ゲームの謎解きも多少変わっていますが、ほとんど一直線で、迷うことはあまりないと思います。
男性主人公＊操ちゃんのEDが個人的にはスッキリ。

36046060.review:
This game is a new and improved version of the first game, with Aki and (M) Aki saving Misao.

The things I really enjoyed:
Seeing how in the two genders you get different scenarios.

Aki is very rough and determined to find Misao
(M) Aki is very kind and sweet while trying to find Misao

I also enjoy the new sprites a lot, not to mention I enjoy the Mad Father refrences a lot. Perfect in every way.

Not to mention I enjoyed how we see the mistakes each "Bad Character" made, especially since back when Misao wasn't on Steam, you had to complete the game to see what they did, but the cut scenes were in the area where the person died

Mr Sotah's new name kinda threw me off but I am growing to like it.

Things I didn't like:
When saving Yoshino it was hard to find the tool to get the bear suit open.

The Bathroom scene was very hard, it will be dificult if you don't know about how to sprint. (Usually its SHIFT, but since SHIFT is quick save that apparently makes D the run key.) 

Bugs I came through: 
Just one,  it was when I was playing male protag, and when I went on Truth it said "complete main storyline first as (M) Aki" so I did that, and in the beginning when Otome dies I held esc. to skip the cut scene I already saw, but I guess I held it a bit too long because it skipped me all the way to truth ending. To everyone's graves. I didn't mind because it was still a nice expierence. 

Overall: 
I reccomend this game if you like Mad Father, or Ib, or you know any rpg horror game, I love all the characters dearly. And I enjoy all the deaths, they gave me a chuckle. So yes I do reccomend this game.

36044626.review:
Ah, this brings back so much memories. I loved the free version of the game and bought this version to support the developers. The story is still as good as I remember it and the bonus content just makes it even better.

If you like classic horror RPG maker games, you'd definitely love Misao.

36028192.review:
Когда проходил её ещё в первый раз, я довольно долго находился под впечатлением. В окончательной версии небезызвестного пиксельного хоррора подкрутили графику (к слову, немного спрайты персонажей дорисовали, если не ошибаюсь) и добавили чуточку дополнительных кат-сцен, так что все неясности, которые были в старой версии, пропали. Английский здесь совсем не трудный, даже без прохождения оригинальной Misao на родном языке, тут всё относительно доходчиво объясняется по мере прохождения. И ещё, внимание, в этой игре есть 40 (!) способов умереть. Такое нельзя пропустить. Это даже лучше, чем в каком-нибудь симуляторе-самоубийцы. История действительно учит положительным вещам, что, например, никогда не надо обижать девочек в своей школе, иначе та умрёт при загадочных обстоятельствах и вскоре на вас падёт её проклятье. Но это шутка, конечно. 

Ну а если серьёзно и по делу, то конец этой игры меня очень растрогал. Снова. Он правда доказывает, что не надо быть плохим человеком и как-то предвзято относиться к другим людям из-за их внешности, что не стоит лицемерить и издеваться над кем-то, что лучше слушать своё сердце, а не чужое мнение, и что ревновать и обманывать - это плохо. Элементарные вещи, которые, может быть, и показаны слишком наивно, но для меня они до сих пор остаются чересчур важными. Не знаю, как на самом деле обстоят дела в японских школах с травлей, но я всё равно советую эту игру как наглядный пример отношения людей друг к другу в подобном обществе (и не только в подобным ему).

36027111.review:
This is a memento of my early twenties, when I was younger and still hopeful for the future, literally a life ago. The "Definitive Edition" of this small gem of RPGMaker's classic horror flavour adds some small CG changes, a complete redesign of the school, and gets rid of some very silly moments from the free version (like a car crashing inside a bathroom, a last minute chase scene at the very end of the Truth route, passwords to input inside computers etc.). In short,  it gets rid of the tedious parts and wraps the package up nicely. It's a 2-hours long super short adventure game where you'll die, a lot, for the stupidest reasons, and you'll love it.

10/10 would splat my head against a wall when the phone ringing startles me again.

35999045.review:
Подумать только, 4 года назад я играл в эту игру и получил от нее массу удовольствия. Удовольствие не столько от сюжета, сколько от тех ловушек, которые подстерегали нашего ГГ на его/ее пути. Эта игра вышла слабее по сюжету, чем Mad Father, но она тоже сумела чем-то зацепить. И вот, недавно выскочил внезапный анонс ремейка Misao. Я заценил скриншоты и дождавшись релиза, приобрел игру. 
По сюжету, ничего нового ремейк не вносит. Жила была девочка по имени Мисао. Тихая, добрая девочка, которая никому не мешала. Но внезапно она пропала. Прошло уже 3 месяца с её пропажи, как в школе начали происходить какие-то странные вещи. То, что-то на кого-то упадет, то кого-то утащат в туалет. И пошли слухи о том, что мертвая девочка Мисао наложила на школу свое проклятье. И в один не прекрасный день, когда ученики из ее класса обсуждали всю паранормальщину, произошло землетрясение. Школу перенесло в другой мир, полный призраков и всяких злобных духов. Мы же играем за ученика или ученицу, который/ая хотел/а подружиться с Мисао. И наша цель - развеять данное проклятье. 
В расспоряжении ГГ находится целая школа. Правда поломанная и наполненная всякой чертовщиной. Чтобы развеять проклятие нам понадобится найти необходимые ключи, которые нужно будет принести потом на алтарь. Таких ключей всего 6, но чтобы их все собрать - придется неплохо повозиться. Не обошлось без ловушек, на которые может попасться наш персонаж. Со времен версии 2013 года этих ловушек прибавилось в разы, и вы даже можете отдельно заценить весь этот список из 40 смертей на небольшой доске. Что-то поменяли, что-то добавили, но в целом выглядит все очень даже здорово. Особенно новые ловушки. Некоторые игровые ивенты сделали более логичными, игравшие в старую версию поймут. 
Поменялся графон как и спрайты, благодаря сделанной анимации персонажи чувствуются более живыми.
Наверное, единственное, что не изменили, так это музыку. Хотя оно и к лучшему. 
Ах да, чуть не забыл. Помните в старой версии была бонусная комната? Забудьте про нее, для вас решили сделать галерею по типу той, что вы видели в меню Mad Father. Отсылок на эту игру, завезли кстати более чем дофига, так что фанаты оценят. Ну и как я мог забыть про ачивки, их тут всего 21 штука, но получаются они тут гораздо легче, чем в том же MF. Как минимум, за счет того, что не надо для них собирать всякие Джемы c:
Ну и какой я могу здесь сделать вывод. Игру перелопатили вдоль и поперек и получилась реальная конфетка. Кат-сцены из финала перекинули в начало-середину игры, чтобы сюжет подавался более равномерно. Добавили нечто новое, и при этом не нарушили старого. Видно, что автор старался и такие труды точно можно поддержать денежкой. Тем более, игра стоит копейки. Так что покупайте и не пожалеете. Игре ставлю твердую десятку :)

35989289.review:
เป็นเกมที่เคยเล่นมาตั้งแต่ตอนแจกให้เล่นฟรี อันนี้เหมือนปรับปรุงหลายๆอย่างให้ดีขึ้นและเพิ่มเนื้อเรื่องบางอย่างมั้ง 
พอเอาลง STEAM ก็ไม่ลังเลที่จะกดซื้อทันที
เกมเป็นแนว Horor RPG แก้ปริศนาหาทางไปต่อเรื่อยๆ และเสพเนื้อเรื่องไปด้วย
เกมนี้มีอะไรๆเกี่ยวกับ Mad father มานิดหน่อย เห็นมีการกล่าวถึงบ้าง
ข้อดี
-เนื้อเรื่องโอเค
-ปริศนาไม่ยากไป(มั้ง สำรหับคนที่เคยเล่นเกมแนวนี้บ้าง แต่ก็ไม่ง่ายไป)
-มีอะไรตลกๆ (หรือคิดไปเอง)
-ราคาไม่แพง
-เซฟได้ตลอด
-ตัวละคร หญิง ชาย มีความแตกต่างกันอยุ่บ้าง เช่น ฉากที่เกิดขึ้น บทพูด สิ่งที่ทำได้และไม่ได้ จึงสามารถกลับมาเล่นอีกครั้งได้โดยไม่ฝืนใจมากนัก (ผู้หญิงกล้ากว่าผู้ชายจริงๆ)

ข้อเสีย
-ไม่ค่อยน่ากลัว ตกใจนิดๆ 
-บางอย่างไม่ Make sense แต่ก็พอได้อยู่
-ตลกตรงการตายแบบตางๆ หน้าตัวเอกตลก หรือวิธีการจนอุทานว่า "อย่างนี้ก็ได้เหรอ" มีกลิ่นอาย ไบรอานผจญภัยนิดๆตรงนี้แหละ กวนมาก
-เกมนี้ยากที่จะไม่ตาย ยกเว้นเป็นคนไม่ค่อยขี้สงสัย เหมือนบังคับให้เราดูว่าตายแบบไหน ที่จริงอาจจะทำแบบ ใช้ความคิดแล้วไม่ตาย น่าจะดีกว่า แต่แบบนี้ก็เป็นอีกแนวที่ใช้ได้ ถ้าไม่หัวร้อนกับการตาย (ว่าละทำไมให้เซฟได้ตลอดเวลา)
-ภาพไม่ค่อยสวย ... ก็มันแนวนี้นี่หว่า!!! แต่อยากให้ภาพชัดกว่านี้หน่อย ถึงที่อยู่มันก็โอเคอยุ่แล้วเถอะ
-อยากให้มีเนื้อเรื่องยาวกว่านี้หน่อย แต่ที่จริงก็ไม่ได้สั้นหรอก

แนะนำให้ซื้อเล่นได้เลย ราคาไม่แพง ไม่น่ากลัวมากนัก ไม่ค่อยหลอน เล่นได้ตลอด แต่ระวังใครป็นโรคหัวใจ Jump Scare เยอะมาก แต่หลังๆน่าจะเดาได้และชิน ไม่รุ้มีจบกี่แบบ จำไม่ได้ แต่น่าติดตามเนื้อเรื่องดีด้วย

เป็นเกมแรกที่เก็บแอคชีพเมนได้เกือบครบ ขาดอยู่อันนึงทำไม่ถูกคือ อ่านไดอารี่ในห้องสมุด ก็มีอยู่อันเดียวบนโต๊ะนี่หว่า

35986647.review: 看到狂父有更新，然后好奇更新了什么。结果发现这个游戏上架了，然后还打折了。虽然我已经视频通关很多遍了，但是现在自己亲身来体验还是心里很方。杀戮天使尸体派对都有了，估计IB魔女之家也不是多远的事情了吧。[spoiler]“来吧，我就半夜玩，我王境泽绝对不怂！”[/spoiler]

39351003.review:
I played the free version years ago, along with Mad Father, when the YouTuber craze around these free RPGMaker games was rampant and I can say I enjoyed this game. Sure, some of the events were silly, like Kudoh getting hit by a car but besides that, the story was good. Especially the Truth ending. That being said, I ended up getting this game weeks back and I finally 100% the game.
Pros:
-Updated art.
-More events.
-More deaths than the original game.
-[spoiler] No more hiding in the closet from Sohta/Kurata during Truth. [/spoiler]
-A more complicated way to hide from the Mad Scientist. [spoiler] It used to be you just hide in the body but now it is click on the closet, try to hide in it, and then grab the scalpel. [/spoiler]
-[spoiler] More links to Aya or Aya's clone being Ms. Library. [/spoiler]
-You cannot play this game by memory. Most of the stuff has been moved around and changed. It is not just a port to steam, it is a new game.
-Instead of collecting body parts, you collect items.
Cons:
-The Rec Room was removed. 

In all fairness, this is one of the best RPGMaker games I've played.
Rating: 10/10

39269127.review: A japanese horror RPGMaker game with good production values and an absolutely batshit insane story.

39203999.review: Ya lo jugué hace muchos años y me agrada el cambio visual que ha tenido hasta entonces, siendo esta versión más refinada en cuanto a diseño pixelado y animaciones. La historia sigue siendo una completa ida de olla, que te dejará atrapado al momento. Lleno de trampas y muertes entre curiosas, inesperadas y hasta divertidas; lo recomiendo encarecidamente a todo aquel fan de los juegos indie de horror.

39173312.review: I've always loved these old rpgs, and seeing that it's been remastered and released on steam made it even better! It's worth the purchase, and I'm glad I can relive this classic AND support the creators this time!

39167554.review: просто превосходная игрушка. жаль, что не успел поиграть в старую версию.

39139383.review:
Misao has always been one of my favourite horror RPG games since I first stumbled upon the genre back in early 2013, so when I saw that it had finally got added to steam I knew I absolutely knew I had to get it! 

Honestly it's a lot like the older free version; however most events have been altered and updated so even if you've played the older version dozens of times like me you'll more then likely still find some joy in this, even if you're just playing to see what's new rather then to experience the story once again.

Really though, I couldn't reccommend this game more and I hope that considering all of the love that this game and Mad Father have been getting that other amazing horror RPG's like The Witch's House and Ib will be added sometime as well.

39047410.review: I never knew I wanted this so badly, and now that I have baught it, I've never been so happy to have been able to experience one of my most favroite RPG maker games once again in this amazing remake.

38999562.review: Unlike Mad Father, I did not play Misao prior to its coming to Steam so it was a new experience playing this game. This game definitely had more moments where you could die just by trying something compared to Mad Father, which definitely made it frustrating at times, but also more comical. I loved it because it is set in the same universe as Mad Father and I believe that some of the characters are in fact the same!

38989778.review: Misao: Definitive Edition is one of the best horror adventure stories that possesses an emotional tension. Overall you get to control your own character traveling through the memories of Misao, unraveling why the horrors are occuring.  This story is highly graphic in detail and highly explicit in the waves of human nature. I recommend this game to the individual that has a strong emotional background and one that likes suspenseful horror.

38957296.review: I played this game listening ''dumb ways to die, soooooo many dumb ways to die'' xD awesome game!

38954948.review:
If you're planning to buy it, but you're not sure about it, then check the previous (free) version of the game first:
http://vgperson.com/games/misao.htm

And now the Definitive Edition. If you know the original story, then the DE won't make any plot twists for you. But that doesn't mean that it's the same as before. The graphics are improved (or changed) as the description says. The map (aka the school) is expanded and changed in some ways. There are more deathtraps, and some of them from the previous versions are taken out. Some of the new traps were pretty funny, because they were so comical / dumb. (No, I won't spoil any of it. Explore it for yourself for your joy!)
About the protagonist in short: Aki is a bit extremist (you will see it, why) and Akito (aka male Aki) is more emotional. It's up to you, who you will choose.

If you know Mad Father, then you will get the things, which were in that game, and which were missed in Misao. [spoiler]I mean the sprite, the artwork and the music collection.[/spoiler]
The only things I missed from this version are [spoiler]the soundtracks of the previous versions and the recreational / "behind the scenes" room.[/spoiler]

39426894.review: I love It and have completed it 100%. Its a bit challenging but I still have fun find things every oe in a while! It also has a good, sad, and creepy story. I give this game a 9.5 out of 10!

39405797.review: 很棒的日式rpgmaker horror game. 恐怖游玩要素很多，剧情可预料但依然动人。

39448154.review: A solid product for fans of horror games of this kind. A little heavy on the sudden deaths, and a strange habit of making the quicksave button the same as the sprint button, but otherwise worth the price tag.

39436643.review: 옛날 아프리카tv에서 한창 쯔꾸르가 유행할 시절 많이 볼수 있었던 미사오 그걸 그래픽 수정 및 맵 일부 변경으로 같은 내용이여도 색다르게 새로 만들어낸 점이 놀랍고 기존버전의 미사오를 안다면 꼭 추천드리고 싶다. 매드파더도 꼭 사서 할꺼다.

39583946.review:
Pros
Fitting Music
Great atmosphere
Nice Art
Controls are smooth and responsive

Neither a pro or a con
Average Story

Cons
Short
mostly Shallow characters
Some achievements are a chore to get (which I will explain why)


As I had mentioned in my cons list this game is short , I beat Misao in roughly an hour and 15 minutes. However yes I do have 4.4 hours into Misao but most of that time was to get all of the achievements. There's achievements for beating the normal game and the after story as Male and Female Aki. ( and yes this includes the normal ending and bad ending) it felt rather redundant and as if it was trying to drag out the game longer than it needed to be for such a simple story. 

I honestly felt Male Aki's route and Female Aki's route were almost completely identical.. with some minor alterations to the story and dialog which barely made them distinguishable.

However with all of that being said don't let that turn you away from Misao it is admittedly one of the better horror RPGmaker Games out there and I did enjoy it I just feltl it was some what over priced.
